lines.dialogueText: You return to the shop to ask about a way to catch the Six-Eyed Fish.

Welcome back, dear customer…
Judging by that look on your face, I’d say you’ve met the Six-Eyed Fish, haven’t you?

Yes… I ran right into it, but it didn’t seem interested in the bait I had.
Do you know any other way to catch it?

Of course, my dear customer!
As it happens, I possess a special kind of bait passed down through my family.
No matter what kind of fish sees it — they’ll be drawn to it without fail!
Perfect! So, how much are you selling it for?
But hold on, my good customer. This time, instead of selling it, how about I ask you for a little favor in exchange for this bait?
…And what kind of job would that be?
I happened to receive a request from a man in the village. He said he accidentally dropped an important iron box belonging to his wife into the river.
I’d like to ask you to help find it for him — it should be somewhere near the pile of debris beneath the river.
Of course, my shop sells magnets specially made for retrieving items underwater. So, what do you say, my good customer? Interested in taking the job?
(Damn it… not only does he give me a job, but I have to buy the magnet too? Well, whatever it takes—I need that special bait of his.)
Fine, I’ll do it. I just hope that bait of yours is worth all this trouble.
Of course, my good customer. I never offer a deal that isn’t worth your while…
